headline: Gov Buni condemns Geidam attack, calls for more support, prayers
summarized_story:

headline: Fresh recruitment into civil service commences in Edo
summarized_story:

The Chairman of Edo Civil Service Commission, Princess Ekiuwa Inneh, urged interested and qualified persons to apply through the civil service commission recruitment portal: csc.edostate.gov.ng.
Inneh assured that the recruitment would be free, fair and merit-driven, while stating the applicants were not required to make payment to any person or organisation, in respect of the recruitment.
She said: “All applications must be submitted on or before May 27, 2022.

summarized_story:

According to the invitation card, the presidential aspirants are expected to present their invitation cards at the gate of the venue otherwise they may be turned back.

headline: Nigerian Police Deploy More Assets To South-East, Warn That Attacks On Stations Won’t Be Tolerated
summarized_story:
The Inspector-General of Police (IGP) Usman Baba Alkali, has warned against attacks on police officers and facilities in the country, especially in the South-East region, saying such would no longer be tolerated by the force.
The police boss, who lamented the destruction of the facilities, other police operational assets across the country, and the killing of officers, also ordered the deployment of additional assets to support the fight against the criminals.

headline: Google’s Africa internet cable arrives in Lagos, Nigeria
summarized_story:
Google has announced that earlier today, Equiano, a subsea internet cable running through Portugal to South Africa landed in Lagos, Nigeria.
This announcement is coming a month after Equiano first landed on the African continent in Togo.
The project, which is named after Nigerian-born writer and abolitionist Olaudah Equiano, is expected to help support further digital transformation in Nigeria, a country with a thriving tech ecosystem.
“Google is committed to supporting Africa’s digital transformation and we are excited to see the impact of the landing of Equiano in Nigeria,” Juliet Ehimuan, Director, West Africa at Google said.
Last October, Google CEO Sundar Pichai announced a plan to invest $1billion over 5 years to support digital transformation in Africa, of which project Equiano is part.

headline: Blockchain-powered insurance: Meet the decentralised insurance protocol, Etherisc, insuring Kenyan farms against bad climate
summarized_story:
Share this article:The concept of decentralised insurance became a theoretical possibility with the emergence of decentralised finance (DeFi).
While DeFi platforms continue to offer borrowing, lending, and staking services, Etherisc, an open-source, decentralised insurance protocol, brings affordable insurance to African farmers away from the complex DeFi protocols.

headline: Betta Edu: APC Expression of Interest Is In The Right Order
summarized_story:
According to the APC National Women Leader, Dr Betta Edu, President Muhammadu Buhari would work in concert with its National Chairman, Senator Abdullahi Adamu, and other organs of the party to come up with acceptable candidates for next year’s general election.
Dr. Edu also stated that the party would not cede its presidential ticket to any aspirant known to be a male chauvinist.
In addition, the party fixed the expression of interest and nomination forms for its presidential ticket at N100m.
While female aspirants will get free nomination forms but will have to pay for their expression of interest forms.
To discuss the latest developments in the ruling All Progressives Congress – the APC, is the National Women Leader, Dr Betta Edu.

headline: Over 15m Passengers Passed Through Nigeria’s Airports in 2021
summarized_story:
The National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) has stated that a total of 15,225,627 travellers passed through Nigeria’s airports in 2021.
The details showed that the total number of international passengers who passed through Nigerian airports was 2,219,146, as against 1,408,026 passengers in 2020.
Similarly, the total number of international passengers who passed through Nigerian airports were 2,219,146 in 2021 as against 1,408,026 passengers in 2020.
A total of 4,758,843 passengers passed through the domestic terminal of the Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport, Abuja, while 4,093,712 passengers passed through the domestic terminals of the Murtala Muhammed Airport, Lagos.
The domestic terminals of Port Harcourt International Airport had 900,728 passengers, Mallam Aminu Kano International Airport (545,749) and Akanu Ibiam International Airport (508,513).
